trustfund: TF022214-CANADIAN GENERAL CTF II-CARIBBEAN,TF039096-JAMAICA - ESW ROSE AND STUDENT LOAN,TF034754-JAMAICA - STUDENT LOAN PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings show an unsatisfactory project
            outcome, unlikely sustainability, with only modest
            institutional development impacts. These unsuccessful
            ratings provide lessons in administering student loans, and
            in providing equitable financing for higher education.
            During project preparation, and appraisal, lessons suggest
            the involvement of all stakeholders (including the private
            sector), to uphold the public interest, and be subjected to
            market discipline, in order to ensure a transparent
            management, based on an analytical framework, and
            assessments of socioeconomic profiles of students, setting
            realistic targets. To this end, project design should ensure
            diversified instruments for financial assistance, less
            dependent on data, and the capacity of the implementing
            agency, but more cost-effective. Lessons on project
            implementation, supervision, and country dialogue, focus on
            the effective provision of technical assistance, and the use
            of more specific legal covenants linking the provision of
            data on loan repayment, defaults, and arrears to a continued
            disbursement, but which alerts the student loan bureau to
            monitor these indicators.
